Detailed Description

Class for doing probe set quantification using median polish as does RMA.

Member Function Documentation

void QuantRma::computeEstimate (  )  [virtual]

Do the heavy lifting of median polish.

If PM-MM is zero threshold at a small positive number to avoid taking logs of numbers that aren't positive.

Implements QuantMethod.

void QuantRma::setUsePrecompFeatureEffects ( bool  value  )  [inline]

Use this to toggle whether or not QuantRma should be using precomputed feature effects (aka feature response, sometimes know incorrectly as 'affinity').

To mimic what occurs in pliers we do not dynamically fit the model using the precomputed feature effects as input. Essentially we do just "one pass" of the med-polish algorithm using the precomputed feature effects and output the resulting chip effects. When this note was written the above procedure is the default behaviour when a precomputed feature effects file is read.

Parameters:
value - true if using precomputed feature effects false otherwise.
